  16. ‌#define CAML_INTERNALS

  18. /* Callbacks from C to OCaml */

  20. #include <string.h>
  21. #include "caml/alloc.h"
  22. #include "caml/callback.h"
  23. #include "caml/codefrag.h"
  24. #include "caml/fail.h"
  25. #include "caml/fiber.h"
  26. #include "caml/memory.h"
  27. #include "caml/mlvalues.h"
  28. #include "caml/platform.h"

  30. /* A note about callbacks and GC.  For best performance, a callback such as
  31.      [caml_callback_exn(value closure, value arg)]
  32.    should not extend the lifetime of the values [closure]
  33.    and [arg] any farther than necessary, that is, they should not be
  34.    registered as GC roots when the function call actually happens.

  36.    This mirrors the reachability/lifetime guarantees provided by
  37.    function calls in OCaml code, where the arguments can be collected
  38.    as soon as they are not used anymore within the function body.

  40.    The closure and its arguments may still have to be registered as
  41.    GC roots, typically across a call to [alloc_and_clear_stack_parent] below,
  42.    but registration should stop before the actual callback.

  44.    See #12121 for more discussion. */

  46. /*
  47. * These functions are to ensure effects are handled correctly inside
  48. * callbacks. There are two aspects:
  49. *  - we clear the stack parent for a callback to force an Effect.Unhandled
  50. *  exception rather than effects being passed over the callback
  51. *  - we register the stack parent as a local root while the callback
  52. * is executing to ensure that the garbage collector follows the
  53. * stack parent
  54. */
  55. ‌Caml_inline value alloc_and_clear_stack_parent(caml_domain_state* domain_state)
  56. {
  57.   struct stack_info* parent_stack = Stack_parent(domain_state->current_stack);
  58.   value cont = caml_alloc_1(Cont_tag, Val_ptr(parent_stack));
  59.   Stack_parent(domain_state->current_stack) = NULL;
  60.   return cont;
  61. }

  63. ‌Caml_inline void restore_stack_parent(caml_domain_state* domain_state,
  64.                                       value cont)
  65. {
  66.   struct stack_info* parent_stack = Ptr_val(Op_val(cont)[0]);
  67.   CAMLassert(Stack_parent(domain_state->current_stack) == NULL);
  68.   Stack_parent(domain_state->current_stack) = parent_stack;
  69. }


  72. #ifndef NATIVE_CODE

  74. /* Bytecode callbacks */

  76. #include "caml/interp.h"
  77. #include "caml/instruct.h"
  78. #include "caml/fix_code.h"
  79. #include "caml/fiber.h"

  81. ‌static __thread opcode_t callback_code[] = { ACC, 0, APPLY, 0, POP, 1, STOP };

  83. ‌static __thread int callback_code_inited = 0;

  85. ‌static void init_callback_code(void)
  86. {
  87.   caml_register_code_fragment((char *) callback_code,
  88.                               (char *) callback_code + sizeof(callback_code),
  89.                               DIGEST_IGNORE, NULL);
  90. #ifdef THREADED_CODE
  91.   caml_thread_code(callback_code, sizeof(callback_code));
  92. #endif
  93.   callback_code_inited = 1;
  94. }

  96. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callbackN_exn(value closure, int narg, value args[])
  97. {
  98.   CAMLparam0(); /* no need to register closure and args as roots, see below */
  99.   CAMLlocal1(cont);
  100.   value res;
  101.   int i;
  102.   caml_domain_state* domain_state = Caml_state;

  104.   CAMLassert(narg + 4 <= 256);
  105.   domain_state->current_stack->sp -= narg + 4;
  106.   for (i = 0; i < narg; i++)
  107.     domain_state->current_stack->sp[i] = args[i]; /* arguments */

  109.   if (!callback_code_inited) init_callback_code();

  111.   callback_code[1] = narg + 3;
  112.   callback_code[3] = narg;

  114.   domain_state->current_stack->sp[narg] =
  115.                      (value)(callback_code + 4); /* return address */
  116.   domain_state->current_stack->sp[narg + 1] = Val_unit;    /* environment */
  117.   domain_state->current_stack->sp[narg + 2] = Val_long(0); /* extra args */
  118.   domain_state->current_stack->sp[narg + 3] = closure;

  120.   cont = alloc_and_clear_stack_parent(domain_state);
  121.   /* This can call the GC and invalidate the values [closure] and [args].
  122.      However, they are never used afterwards,
  123.      as they were copied into the root [domain_state->current_stack]. */

  125.   res = caml_interprete(callback_code, sizeof(callback_code));
  126.   if (Is_exception_result(res))
  127.     domain_state->current_stack->sp += narg + 4; /* PR#3419 */

  129.   restore_stack_parent(domain_state, cont);

  131.   CAMLreturn (res);
  132. }

  134. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callback_exn(value closure, value arg1)
  135. {
  136.   value arg[1];
  137.   arg[0] = arg1;
  138.   return caml_callbackN_exn(closure, 1, arg);
  139. }

  141. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callback2_exn(value closure, value arg1, value arg2)
  142. {
  143.   value arg[2];
  144.   arg[0] = arg1;
  145.   arg[1] = arg2;
  146.   return caml_callbackN_exn(closure, 2, arg);
  147. }

  149. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callback3_exn(value closure,
  150.                                value arg1, value arg2, value arg3)
  151. {
  152.   value arg[3];
  153.   arg[0] = arg1;
  154.   arg[1] = arg2;
  155.   arg[2] = arg3;
  156.   return caml_callbackN_exn(closure, 3, arg);
  157. }

  159. #else

  161. /* Native-code callbacks.  caml_callback[123]_asm are implemented in asm. */

  163. ‌static void init_callback_code(void)
  164. {
  165. }

  167. ‌typedef value (callback_stub)(caml_domain_state* state,
  168.                               value closure,
  169.                               value* args);

  171. ‌‌‌callback_stub caml_callback_asm, caml_callback2_asm, caml_callback3_asm;

  173. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callback_exn(value closure, value arg)
  174. {
  175.   Caml_check_caml_state();
  176.   caml_domain_state* domain_state = Caml_state;
  177.   caml_maybe_expand_stack();

  179.   if (Stack_parent(domain_state->current_stack)) {
  180.     value cont, res;

  182.     /* [closure] and [arg] need to be preserved across the allocation
  183.        of the stack parent, but need not and should not be registered
  184.        as roots past this allocation. */
  185.     Begin_roots2(closure, arg);
  186.     cont = alloc_and_clear_stack_parent(domain_state);
  187.     End_roots();

  189.     Begin_roots1(cont);
  190.     res = caml_callback_asm(domain_state, closure, &arg);
  191.     End_roots();

  193.     restore_stack_parent(domain_state, cont);

  195.     return res;
  196.   } else {
  197.     return caml_callback_asm(domain_state, closure, &arg);
  198.   }
  199. }

  201. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callback2_exn(value closure, value arg1, value arg2)
  202. {
  203.   Caml_check_caml_state();
  204.   caml_domain_state* domain_state = Caml_state;
  205.   caml_maybe_expand_stack();

  207.   if (Stack_parent(domain_state->current_stack)) {
  208.     value cont, res;

  210.     /* Root registration policy: see caml_callback_exn. */
  211.     Begin_roots3(closure, arg1, arg2);
  212.     cont = alloc_and_clear_stack_parent(domain_state);
  213.     End_roots();

  215.     Begin_roots1(cont);
  216.     value args[] = {arg1, arg2};
  217.     res = caml_callback2_asm(domain_state, closure, args);
  218.     End_roots();

  220.     restore_stack_parent(domain_state, cont);

  222.     return res;
  223.   } else {
  224.     value args[] = {arg1, arg2};
  225.     return caml_callback2_asm(domain_state, closure, args);
  226.   }
  227. }

  229. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callback3_exn(value closure,
  230.                                     value arg1, value arg2, value arg3)
  231. {
  232.   Caml_check_caml_state();
  233.   caml_domain_state* domain_state = Caml_state;
  234.   caml_maybe_expand_stack();

  236.   if (Stack_parent(domain_state->current_stack))  {
  237.     value cont, res;

  239.     /* Root registration policy: see caml_callback_exn. */
  240.     Begin_roots4(closure, arg1, arg2, arg3);
  241.     cont = alloc_and_clear_stack_parent(domain_state);
  242.     End_roots();

  244.     Begin_root(cont);
  245.     value args[] = {arg1, arg2, arg3};
  246.     res = caml_callback3_asm(domain_state, closure, args);
  247.     End_roots();

  249.     restore_stack_parent(domain_state, cont);

  251.     return res;
  252.   } else {
  253.     value args[] = {arg1, arg2, arg3};
  254.     return caml_callback3_asm(domain_state, closure, args);
  255.   }
  256. }

  258. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callbackN_exn(value closure, int narg, value args[]) {
  259.   while (narg >= 3) {
  260.     /* We apply the first 3 arguments to get a new closure,
  261.        and continue with the remaining arguments. */
  262.     value *remaining_args = args + 3;
  263.     int remaining_narg = narg - 3;

  265.     /* We need to register the remaining arguments as roots
  266.        in case a GC occurs during [caml_callback3_exn].
  267.        Arguments 0, 1 and 2 need not and should not be registered. */
  268.     Begin_roots_block(remaining_args, remaining_narg);
  269.     closure = caml_callback3_exn(closure, args[0], args[1], args[2]);
  270.     End_roots();

  272.     if (Is_exception_result(closure)) return closure;

  274.     args = remaining_args;
  275.     narg = remaining_narg;
  276.   }
  277.   switch (narg) {
  278.   case 0:
  279.     return closure;
  280.   case 1:
  281.     return caml_callback_exn(closure, args[0]);
  282.   default: /* case 2: */
  283.     return caml_callback2_exn(closure, args[0], args[1]);
  284.   }
  285. }

  287. #endif

  289. /* Exception-propagating variants of the above */

  291. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callback (value closure, value arg)
  292. {
  293.   return caml_raise_if_exception(caml_callback_exn(closure, arg));
  294. }

  296. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callback2 (value closure, value arg1, value arg2)
  297. {
  298.   return caml_raise_if_exception(caml_callback2_exn(closure, arg1, arg2));
  299. }

  301. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callback3 (value closure, value arg1, value arg2,
  302.                                  value arg3)
  303. {
  304.   return caml_raise_if_exception(caml_callback3_exn(closure, arg1, arg2, arg3));
  305. }

  307. ‌CAMLexport value caml_callbackN (value closure, int narg, value args[])
  308. {
  309.   return caml_raise_if_exception(caml_callbackN_exn(closure, narg, args));
  310. }

  312. /* Naming of OCaml values */

  314. ‌struct named_value {
  315.   value val;
  316.   struct named_value * next;
  317.   char name[1];
  318. };

  320. ‌#define Named_value_size 13

  322. ‌static struct named_value * named_value_table[Named_value_size] = { NULL, };
  323. ‌static caml_plat_mutex named_value_lock = CAML_PLAT_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;

  325. ‌void caml_init_callbacks(void)
  326. {
  327.   init_callback_code();
  328. }

  330. ‌static unsigned int hash_value_name(char const *name)
  331. {
  332.   unsigned int h;
  333.   /* "djb2" hash function */
  334.   for (h = 5381; *name != 0; name++) h = h * 33 + *name;
  335.   return h % Named_value_size;
  336. }

  338. ‌CAMLprim value caml_register_named_value(value vname, value val)
  339. {
  340.   struct named_value * nv;
  341.   const char * name = String_val(vname);
  342.   size_t namelen = strlen(name);
  343.   unsigned int h = hash_value_name(name);
  344.   int found = 0;

  346.   caml_plat_lock(&named_value_lock);
  347.   for (nv = named_value_table[h]; nv != NULL; nv = nv->next) {
  348.     if (strcmp(name, nv->name) == 0) {
  349.       caml_modify_generational_global_root(&nv->val, val);
  350.       found = 1;
  351.       break;
  352.     }
  353.   }
  354.   if (!found) {
  355.     nv = (struct named_value *)
  356.       caml_stat_alloc(sizeof(struct named_value) + namelen);
  357.     memcpy(nv->name, name, namelen + 1);
  358.     nv->val = val;
  359.     nv->next = named_value_table[h];
  360.     named_value_table[h] = nv;
  361.     caml_register_generational_global_root(&nv->val);
  362.   }
  363.   caml_plat_unlock(&named_value_lock);
  364.   return Val_unit;
  365. }

  367. ‌CAMLexport const value* caml_named_value(char const *name)
  368. {
  369.   struct named_value * nv;
  370.   caml_plat_lock(&named_value_lock);
  371.   for (nv = named_value_table[hash_value_name(name)];
  372.        nv != NULL;
  373.        nv = nv->next) {
  374.     if (strcmp(name, nv->name) == 0){
  375.       caml_plat_unlock(&named_value_lock);
  376.       return &nv->val;
  377.     }
  378.   }
  379.   caml_plat_unlock(&named_value_lock);
  380.   return NULL;
  381. }

  383. ‌CAMLexport void caml_iterate_named_values(caml_named_action f)
  384. {
  385.   int i;
  386.   caml_plat_lock(&named_value_lock);
  387.   for(i = 0; i < Named_value_size; i++){
  388.     struct named_value * nv;
  389.     for (nv = named_value_table[i]; nv != NULL; nv = nv->next) {
  390.       f( Op_val(nv->val), nv->name );
  391.     }
  392.   }
  393.   caml_plat_unlock(&named_value_lock);
  394. }
